Installing the R-K Toolkit and Usage

Installation

The R-K Toolkit depends on a few scientific libraries, which come preinstalled with environments like Anaconda. The R-K Toolkit also depends on :code: nevergrad library which can be installed via :code: pip as below.

pip install nevergrad

More information about :code: nevergrad can be found at their official Git Repository .

The R-K Toolkit can be installed using :code: pip from the toolkit folder as given below.

This will install the R-K Toolkit package. A virtualenv may also be used to install for a specific project.

..image:
